verses.text_plain: O Lord, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.
verses.verse_html: 1O Lord, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

verses.text_plain: For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.
verses.verse_html: 2For thine arrows stick fast in me, and thy hand presseth me sore.

verses.text_plain: There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin.
verses.verse_html:
3There is no soundness in my flesh because of thine anger; neither is there any rest in my bones because of my sin. ▼
▼ rest: Heb. peace, or, health

footnotes.body_html: ▼ rest: Heb. peace, or, health

verses.text_plain: For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.
verses.verse_html: 4For mine iniquities are gone over mine head: as an heavy burden they are too heavy for me.

verses.text_plain: My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.
verses.verse_html: 5My wounds stink and are corrupt because of my foolishness.

verses.text_plain: I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long.
verses.verse_html:
6I am troubled; I am bowed down greatly; I go mourning all the day long. ▼
▼ troubled: Heb. wried

verses.text_plain: For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.
verses.verse_html: 7For my loins are filled with a loathsome disease: and there is no soundness in my flesh.

verses.text_plain: I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.
verses.verse_html: 8I am feeble and sore broken: I have roared by reason of the disquietness of my heart.

verses.text_plain: Lord, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.
verses.verse_html: 9Lord, all my desire is before thee; and my groaning is not hid from thee.

verses.text_plain: My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me.
verses.verse_html:
10My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of mine eyes, it also is gone from me. ▼
▼ is gone…: Heb. is not with me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ is gone…: Heb. is not with me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ is gone…: Heb. is not with me

verses.text_plain: My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off.
verses.verse_html:
11My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my kinsmen stand afar off. ▼
▼ sore: Heb. stroke
 , ▼
▼ my kinsmen: or, my neighbours

footnotes.body_html: ▼ my kinsmen: or, my neighbours

verses.text_plain: They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.
verses.verse_html: 12They also that seek after my life lay snares for me: and they that seek my hurt speak mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long.

verses.text_plain: But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.
verses.verse_html: 13But I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I was as a dumb man that openeth not his mouth.

verses.text_plain: Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.
verses.verse_html: 14Thus I was as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no reproofs.

tokens.text: Thus I was as a man

verses.text_plain: For in thee, O Lord, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God.
verses.verse_html:
15For in thee, O Lord, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O Lord my God. ▼
▼ in…: or, thee do I wait for
 , ▼
▼ hear: or, answer

footnotes.body_text: ▼ in…: or, thee do I wait for
footnotes.body_html: ▼ in…: or, thee do I wait for

verses.text_plain: For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.
verses.verse_html: 16For I said, Hear me, lest otherwise they should rejoice over me: when my foot slippeth, they magnify themselves against me.

verses.text_plain: For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me.
verses.verse_html:
17For I am ready to halt, and my sorrow is continually before me. ▼
▼ to halt: Heb. for halting

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to halt: Heb. for halting

verses.text_plain: For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.
verses.verse_html: 18For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.

verses.text_plain: But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied.
verses.verse_html:
19But mine enemies are lively, and they are strong: and they that hate me wrongfully are multiplied. ▼
▼ are lively…: Heb. being living, are strong

footnotes.body_text: ▼ are lively…: Heb. being living, are strong
footnotes.body_html: ▼ are lively…: Heb. being living, are strong

verses.text_plain: They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.
verses.verse_html: 20They also that render evil for good are mine adversaries; because I follow the thing that good is.

verses.text_plain: Forsake me not, O Lord: O my God, be not far from me.
verses.verse_html: 21Forsake me not, O Lord: O my God, be not far from me.

verses.text_plain: Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.
verses.verse_html:
22Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation. ▼
▼ to…: Heb. for my help

footnotes.body_html: ▼ to…: Heb. for my help
